landing.disclaimer: *Eurostat and National CPA 2.1 and NSTR classifications may differ

map.title: Interactive map
map.body:
This section provides a map displaying for each country the total population, some macro-economic indicators, main imported and exported goods ,and main trade partner countries.

Moreover, a time-lapse functionality to represent the international trade year-on-year monthly variations for the last three years is provided.

extra-ue.title: Graph analysis UE - Extra UE
extra-ue.body:
This section shows the graph plot of international trade based on COMEXT transport data (NSTR classification), along with relevant global and local measures detailing the structure of relations between UE and Extra UE countries. The panel is interactive, providing the possibility to apply several filters and to see how the graph structure and measures change accordingly.

Furthermore an animation is provided showing the evolution of the international trade graph over time, spanning the entire time window of trading data.
extra-ue.link: Go to Graph analisys section UE - Extra UE

intra-ue.title: Graph analysis UE - World
intra-ue.body:
This section shows the graph plot of international trade based on COMEXT data, with 3 digits CPA 2.1 product classification, along with relevant global and local measures detailing the structure of relations between UE countries and their economic partners. The panel is interactive, providing the possibility to apply several filters and to see how the graph structure and measures change accordingly.

Furthermore an animation is provided showing the evolution of the international trade graph over time, spanning the entire time window of trading data.
intra-ue.link: Go to Graph analisys section UE - World

timeseries.title: Time series
timeseries.body: Visualization tool for monthly COMEXT foreign trade data. Despite the large amount of underlying data, it allows an easily understandable series reading. Time series are provided in euros and dowload is available in various formats.

trade.title: Basket of traded products
trade.body: This section provides, for each Member State, the monthly time series of basket composition for exported and imported goods, classified according to 2 digits CPA 2.1, together with year-over-year changes.
trade.link: Go to Basket of traded products section

main.title: Economic and International Trade Indicators
main.body: This section provides a map displaying for each country the total population, some macro-economic indicators, main imported and exported goods ,and main trade partner countries. Moreover, a time-lapse functionality to represent the international trade year-on-year monthly variations for the last three years is provided.

 Decrease the treshold or change means of transport

main.title: International Trade Relations
main.subtitle: Graph analysis
main.body:
The “International Trade Relations” Panel shows the graph analysis of the international trades between countries.
Data are relative to all trades between countries present in the COMEXT dataset. The requested data can be selected through filters. Countries are identified by their flags and their relative positions in the graph are given by the “Spring layout algorithm” implemented in the Network library.

metrics.subtitle: Metrics
metrics.body:
The following metrics derive from standard centrality measures of Graph Analysis.
  • Product spread: Graph density. Represents how much the product is spread through the graph.
    • Exportation strength: it is the outdegree centrality for each country.
  • Vulnerability: it is calculated as 1 - the indegree centrality for each country. The vulnerability conveys the message that a country receiving a product from several countries is less dependent on singles countries for the product supply.
  • Hubness: it is the closeness centrality of the countries.

filter.title: Search filters description
filter.body:
Period: select the required time period for data underlying the graph (specific month or year)
Percentile: select the percentile of data shown in the graph (integer value from 0 to 100). Once the percentile value is selected the data are filtered according to the following procedure: all the amounts (values in Euro) traded between countries (all edges) are listed in a descending order, then the cumulative sum is calculated along the list, from the top. All the trades associated to a cumulative sum above the percentile value, taken as threshold, are filtered out. This means that small trading amounts are considered in the graph only when “percentile” takes an high value.
Transport: select data according to the means of transport used in the trades. The listed means of transport are:
“unknown”, “sea”, “rail”, “road”, ”air”, “post”, “fixed mechanism”, “inland waterway”, “self-propulsion”.
Product: select data according to the product exchanged in the trades. The user can select either a single product or all of them together.
Flow: select either “Export” data or “Import” data, coming from two separate datasets.
Weight: select the type of graph analysis. “True” select the weighted type of graph, “False” select the unweighted type of graph. Values for the links weights are the amounts (values in Euro) exchanged in the trades.

main.title: Time Series visualizatiion
main.body: Visualization tool for monthly COMEXT foreign trade data. Despite the large amount of underlying data, it allows an easily understandable series reading. Time series are provided in euros and dowload is available in various formats.

message.empty: No time series is available for the selected filters!

main.title: Changes in basket composition of traded products (CPA - classification of products by activity) by Member State
main.body: This section provides, for each Member State, the monthly time series of year-over-year changes in the basket composition of exported and imported goods, classified according to 2 digits CPA 2.1.

privacy.title_1: Privacy and protection of personal data
privacy.paragraph_2a: The data controller is the National Institute of Statistics, with headquarters in via Cesare Balbo 16, 00184 Rome (
privacy.paragraph_3: The Data Protection Officer (DPO) can be reached at the following address: National Institute of Statistics – Personal Data Protection Officer, via Cesare Balbo 16, 00184 Rome, email
privacy.paragraph_4: The personal data indicated on this page are processed by Istat for the performance of the public interest tasks entrusted to it (Article 15 of Legislative Decree No. 322/1989), as well as to ensure the functionality of the site.
privacy.paragraph_5a: I sistemi informatici e le procedure software preposte al funzionamento di questo sito acquisiscono, nel corso del loro normale esercizio, alcuni dati personali la cui trasmissione è implicita nell’uso dei protocolli di comunicazione di Internet.
privacy.paragraph_5b: In questa categoria di dati rientrano gli indirizzi IP o i nomi a dominio dei computer e dei terminali utilizzati dagli utenti, gli indirizzi in notazione URI/URL (Uniform Resource Identifier/Locator) delle risorse richieste, l’orario della richiesta, il metodo utilizzato nel sottoporre la richiesta al server, la dimensione del file ottenuto in risposta, il codice numerico indicante lo stato della risposta data dal server (buon fine, errore, ecc.) ed altri parametri relativi al sistema operativo e all’ambiente informatico dell’utente.
privacy.paragraph_5c: Tali dati, necessari per la fruizione dei servizi web, vengono  anche trattati allo scopo di:
privacy.paragraph_5d: ottenere informazioni statistiche sull’uso dei servizi e i prodotti offerti (numero di accessi, numero di visitatori per fascia oraria o giornaliera, pagine più visitate, numero di click sul contenuto offerto e numero di interazioni con lo stesso, aree geografiche di provenienza degli utenti, ecc.);
privacy.paragraph_5e: controllare il corretto funzionamento dei servizi offerti
privacy.paragraph_5f: I dati di navigazione non persistono per più di novanta giorni.
privacy.paragraph_5g: Cookie e altri sistemi di tracciamento
privacy.paragraph_5h: Questo sito fa esclusivo uso di cookie tecnici, ossia di file di testo depositati sul computer degli utenti, necessari per il funzionamento e il monitoraggio del sito stesso. Non viene fatto uso di cookie per la profilazione degli utenti.
privacy.paragraph_5i: Viene fatto uso di cookie tecnici di sessione (non persistenti), in modo strettamente limitato a quanto necessario per la navigazione sicura ed efficiente dei siti.
privacy.paragraph_6a: The interested parties have the right to obtain from the National Statistics Institute, in the cases provided for, access to their personal data and the correction or cancellation of the same or the limitation of the processing that concerns them or to oppose the processing (articles 15 and following of the Regulation). The specific application to Istat can be presented in the following ways:
privacy.paragraph_6b: by post, by sending the request to the address: National Institute of Statistics – Person in charge of the protection of personal data, via Cesare Balbo 16, 00184 Rome;
privacy.paragraph_6c: by e-mail, writing to the address:
privacy.paragraph_7: Interested parties who believe that the processing of their personal data relates to this website have the right to a right against the Guarantor for the protection of personal data, as provided for by art. 77 of the Regulation, or to assume suitable judicial offices (Article 79 of the Regulation itself).
